Message: Okay, I'm here to help. I understand you're experiencing a headache. To get a better understanding of what might be going on, can you describe the location of your headache? Is it all over your head, or is it concentrated in a specific area like your temples, forehead, or back of your head?
Okay, you're experiencing a headache concentrated in the back of your head. How would you describe the type of pain you're experiencing? Is it throbbing, stabbing, a dull ache, or something else?

Okay, you're experiencing a throbbing headache in the back of your head. On a scale of 0 to 10, with 0 being no pain and 10 being the worst pain you can imagine, how would you rate the intensity of your headache?

Okay, you're experiencing a throbbing headache in the back of your head, and you rate the pain intensity as a 7 out of 10.

A throbbing headache at the back of the head could potentially be related to tension headaches or even certain types of migraines. It's important to gather more information to narrow down the possibilities.

Have you noticed any other symptoms accompanying the headache, such as nausea, sensitivity to light or sound, or visual disturbances?

Okay, you're experiencing a throbbing headache in the back of your head with sensitivity to light and rate the pain intensity as a 7 out of 10.

Sensitivity to light (photophobia) along with a throbbing headache is commonly associated with migraines. Given that, have you noticed any changes in your vision, such as blurred vision, seeing spots or flashing lights (aura

Okay, you're experiencing a throbbing headache in the back of your head with sensitivity to light, floaters and rate the pain intensity as a 7 out of 10.

The presence of floaters, along with throbbing pain and light sensitivity, further suggests a migraine. Have you experienced floaters before, or is this a new symptom accompanying this particular headache?

Okay, you're experiencing a throbbing headache in the back of your head with sensitivity to light, floaters, and rate the pain intensity as a 7 out of 10.

The presence of floaters, along with throbbing pain and light sensitivity, can sometimes be associated with ocular migraines or other conditions affecting the eyes. Have you noticed if the headache is worse when you move your eyes?

Okay, you're experiencing a throbbing headache in the back of your head with sensitivity to light, new floaters, the pain is a 7 out of 10, and the headache is worse when you move your eyes.

Headaches that worsen with eye movement, combined with floaters and light sensitivity, could point to a few possibilities, including eye strain-related headaches or even certain types of migraines. Do you wear glasses or contacts, and if so, when was your last eye exam?
